intro: Warpuria serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering warpuria, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
